sentences: Opettaja teki oppilaiden jaon kolmeen ryhmään.
Talon jako perillisille oli monimutkainen prosessi.
Suomella ei ollut mitään jakoa pelissä Saksaa vastaan.
context: The word 'jako' refers to the act of dividing something into parts, or the result of that division. It can also mean a share or portion of something. In colloquial contexts, it can refer to having a chance at something. The noun declines based on case; for example, 'jaon' is the genitive singular form meaning 'of the division', and 'jakoa' is the partitive singular form indicating an indefinite amount of division. It also has possessive forms depending on who owns the share, like 'jakoni' (my share) or 'jakomme' (our share).
